results.title: A Small town idol
results.creator_credit: Mack Sennett, Mack Sennett Comedies and Erle C Kenton
results.brief_description: Slapstick comedy about small town resident, Sam Smith (Ben Turpin) who has been framed for stealing by the scoundrel J. Wellington Jones as a ploy to stop him from wooing Mary (Phyllis Haver), the prettiest single girl in town. Cast also includes Charlie Murray, Marie Prevost, Billy Bevan.

results.title: A Skeleton in the crop: the story of skeleton weed (chondrilla juncea) in Australia
results.creator_credit: S.T. Evans, CSIRO and David Corke
results.brief_description: Ever since Skeleton Weed was first discovered in Australia in the early 1900’s, farmers and scientists have been searching for a way to stop it spreading through the wheatlands of New South Wales, Victoria and South Australia. This is the story of their search. Using archival footage and stills, it tells of the early frustrations over failure to eradicate the weed, the hostility of wheat farmers faced with a problem they did not understand, and their growing appreciation of the role of scientific research in devising the best methods of keeping Skeleton Weed in check.

results.title: A single life: Ethel May 'Monte' Punshon 1882-1989
results.creator_credit: Nancy Peck and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Produced with the assistance of the Australian Womens Archival Project, Women’s Program of the Australian Film Commission, the interview filmed over two days in September 1988 when Monte Punshon was nearly 106 years old. The retired teacher of Japanese talks about her life and philosophy. She lived through two World Wars and two sightings of Hailey’s Comet. She was born in 1882 and died in 1989 at the age of 106. Monte squeezed several lifetimes into one, working as a governess, radio announcer, detention camp commander and author. She had a sixty year association with Japan, including being awarded one of Japan’s highest honours. A biographical guide to her life is included inside the video cover.

results.title: A Simple plan
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Company, Paramount Pictures, James Jacks, Adam Schroeder and Sam Raimi
results.brief_description: When three men (Bill Paxton, Billy Bob Thornton, Brent Briscoe) find a duffle bag full of money in a plane wreck in the Minnesota woods, they decide to hold onto it. If no-one claims the money they’ll divide it between them and leave town. If it is claimed however, they’ll burn it so that it can’t be traced to them. Even the simplest of plans can start to unravel though when there’s a 4.4 million secret at stake. A taught thriller which shows just what lengths some people will go to to acquire the American dream.

results.title: A Simple good time
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough, Bill Steller, Australia-Japan Foundation and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into Japan”.
Describes the way the Japanese take holidays which are usually short and in the company of workmates. It explores their character by following a group of factory workers as they go on a weekend holiday tour of the southern island of Kyushu. We also see how weddings and honeymoons are conducted on Kyushu. Presented by Keith Adam.

results.title: A Sign Is a fine investment
results.creator_credit: Arts Council of Great Britain and Judith Williamson
results.brief_description: From the 1890s until the 1930s, early advertising frequently used images of industrial work to sell its products. Modern advertising, on the other hand, surrounds us with images of idealised homes and families, shopping and holidays, offering a world of consumerism in which work has become invisible. This film investigates the disappearance of work from advertising

results.title: A Sick child in hospital
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Looks at the procedures and stresses associated with a young child being taken to hospital, and gives some life saving first aid procedures.

results.title: A Short story about love
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Karen Wootton
results.brief_description: Karen is young, travelling and in love. When she returns from her travels she discovers she has HIV and with this diagnosis her life changes. Karen must come to terms with life’s new circumstances as she laments the fact that she may never have another relationship or be a mother. But life does move on for Karen and with the help of friends and family, Karen finds love again.
